intro: Boraginella latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled bugloss, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands or along stream banks. Its flowers are tubular with five broad, spreading sepals, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
